xml.metadata:
xnbData: target: "w" compressed: true hiDef: true readerData: - type: "Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.DictionaryReader`2[[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089],[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]" version: 0
- type: "Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.StringReader" version: 0
numSharedResources: 0
content: #!Dictionary<String,String>
xml.p: 4: "...Have you encountered others like me, in the mines? I'm sorry if they were hostile towards you. You see, we've learned to fear humans... there have been too many... unpleasant encounters.#$e#You haven't... slain any of my friends, have you?" #!String
8: "A 1000 year war between my people and the dwarves recently ended. There's still a lot of resentment on both sides." #!String
15: "Please keep my location a secret. If the dwarves knew of me, they'd surely send an assassin." #!String
reject_868: "Oh, it's an arctic shard! That's a very rare magical item.#$b#I'd bring that to the Wizard if I were you!" #!String
Wed: "I find things here and I sell them. Care to buy anything?" #!String
Wed6: "If you put your ear up to the right pipe, you can hear into any house from down here.#$b#I wouldn't eavesdrop, though!$3" #!String
Thu: "Please don't tell anyone about me.#$b#Humans tend to destroy things they can't understand." #!String

Thu6: "Please don't tell anyone about me.#$b#Most humans are frightened by us shadow people... maybe for good reason.$s#$b#But regardless, if the townspeople knew about me, I might not be safe here." #!String
Tue: "I am too sensitive to sunlight to go out on most days.#$b#The conditions in here are perfect.#$e#Care to buy anything?" #!String
Mon: "Please, don't be alarmed. I am different than the others.#$e#I've spent a lot of time observing humans. I know you like to shop. Care to see my wares?" #!String
Mon2: "Back again? I suppose it does fit into my theory of human behavior." #!String
Sat: "On Fridays I stay silent as a sign of devotion to Yoba." #!String
Sun: "...Sorry, I'm still a little wary of humans. My shop is still open to you, however." #!String
Sun4: "You're not like the other humans, are you?" #!String
Sun8: "You've opened my eyes to the world of humans. I appreciate that." #!String
